content: One of the things I need to do, or get done, is to fill out the page here: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/. If you go there right now, you'll get a 403 Directory Listing denied. What I really want on this page is an organised list of US FHIR Implementation Guides, by project / accelerator, along with some key references to US FHIR process pages.
Is anyone interested in working on this? (whatever work will be done will have to be under the authority of the US Realm Steering Committee @Brett Marquard)
Technically, it could (at least partially) be built automatically from this json file: https://github.com/FHIR/ig-registry/blob/master/fhir-ig-list.json
so, like going to https://registry.fhir.org/guides and filtering on USA? that can already be done. right?
Thanks Grahame, it would be great if 80% could be pulled from the fhir-ig-list.json. Does Hl7 HQ keep a solid list? I am happy to provide some content/layout guidance/rules for inclusion

fhir-ig-list.json is updated as part of the publication process, so it's maintained.

I envisage more than simply

going to https://registry.fhir.org/guides and filtering on USA

I think we should have a curated presentation with narrative, and sub-tables that are populated from the underlying data source
